p:
Of the 333 infants with pneumonia, 17 had CoV-positive nasopharyngeal swabs [7 (41.2%) with HKU1, 5 (29.4%) with CoV OC43, 3 (17.7%) with CoV NL63, 2 (11.8%) with CoV 229E] and 31 had an influenza-positive swab [22 (71%) with Influenza A, 9 (29%) with Influenza B]. Cough seems less prevalent in COVID-19 compared with other infected infants (Table 1). While no deaths occurred in infants with COVID-19,
2 3 infants infected with CoV in Pneumo-study died, 2 of whom were co-infected with Streptococcus pneumoniae.
